# Lookingglass Creek

| subdivision_name1 = United States
| subdivision_type2 = State

| subdivision_name3 = Union County

Lookingglass Creek is an  long stream in the U.S. state of Oregon, located in Union County. Starting in the Umatilla National Forest near Tollgate, it flows generally east then turns south to join the Grande Ronde River about  north of Elgin. The Lookingglass Fish Hatchery is located on the creek.
On March 29, 2024, a tanker truck carrying Chinook salmon smolt crashed after leaving the hatchery. The majority of the fish escaped into the river and survived.
